author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
The formatter makes calcuations based on the current window width and lines longer than the width gets a linebreak inserted or truncated (depending on formatter).  This causes two problems:

1. modern terminals (including Win10 console) that support dynamic resizing, when you resize, the line stays broken when the line wrapping should be handled by the terminal
2. when output to file, it retains the width of the console (or information is lost) which is not useful when read in a GUI app or in a different sized console

Need to consider if need to support opt-in to old behavior.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
$text = "0123456789"                                                           
while ($text.Length -lt [console]::WindowWidth) { $text += $text }             
$obj = [pscustomobject]@{a=$text}                                              
$obj > obj.txt                                                            
cat ./obj.txt                                                             
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
??
a                                                                                              
-                                                                                              
01234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
a                                                                                              
-                                                                                              
01234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456...
```

title: Formatting of objects breaks long lines by inserting linebreaks or truncating
